creditline: Gift of funds from Nivin MacMillan in honor of Kaywin Feldman
description: black and white image of young girl sitting against a wall in a denim vest, ripped jeans, and velcro shoes, with a basket on her PR and floral arrangement at her feet; a long, white veil with lace edges lies across ground in foreground, over leaves (petals?) scattered on ground; adult figure stands on L holding jacket in front of body, visible from waist down
inscription: verso, LL in pencil: Girl and Wedding Veil - Guanajuato, Mexico 2018. P. 2019
medium: Inkjet print on Hahnemuhle photo rag pearl paper
text: Martha Driessen is a self-taught photographer based in Minnesota. Drawn to documenting the lives of Chicano communities across the Midwest, her photographs capture moments of joy, connection, and contemplation that might otherwise have been lost in the tumult of street fairs, holiday celebrations, and family gatherings. As a bicultural woman photographing Mexican culture on both sides of the US border, Driessen reveals the commonalities across (and despite) the political divide.
title: Girl and Wedding Veil
